module_restrictions: Some courses have prerequisites, and some courses are not open to exchange students. Lund University allows exchange students to read a maximum of 30 credits per semester + a 3 credits introductory course in Swedish (SUSA) per semester. Courses may vary in the number of credits.
visa_info: Students from countries outside the EU/EEA need a residence permit to study in Sweden.
Exchange students coming to Sweden from a non-EU/EEA country may need a residence permit or visa to enter Sweden, depending on your citizenship.
accommodations_info: Lund University provides various housing options, and students are encouraged to actively search for housing through different agencies.
Application periods: Autumn semester: 1–25 April, Spring semester: 1–25 October
cost_of_living: The estimated monthly living expenses are SEK8,100–SEK9,700, which include accommodation, food, transport, telephone/internet, and other expenses. Students requiring a residence permit must demonstrate that they have funds of at least SEK 8,514 per month of study.
